topic.title: To check in an agreement document

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: To check in an agreement document

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: How to check in an agreement DOCX into X-Author to save drafts, create new versions, and apply redlines for audit and tracking.

li.p: From the X-Author pane, click Check In.

stepresult.p: The Check-in Options page is displayed.

li.p: Under Options Save , choose one of three options for saving the document:

entry.p: This saves a draft version of the agreement document with all markups and Redlines is added to the suggested file name. Selecting this option creates a Minor (Negotiator) version under the Document Version Details related list in your Agreement record.

This saves a draft version of the document without markups and is typically done before sending an agreement to a third party for review. Track changes/redlines and comments are automatically removed from the Word file and Clean is added by default to the suggested file name. Selecting this option creates a Major version under the Document Version Details related list in your Agreement record.

This saves a version of the document without markups and also enables a PDF version of the document to be created. Final is added to the suggested file name. If this option is selected, both a Major Word version is saved to Document Version Details and a PDF file is be saved to the agreement's Notes & Attachments related list.

li.p: In the Name field, enter the required name for the document or leave it as the name suggested by X-Author.

p.p: The default name includes the agreement name, revision number, and version type. You do not need to specify a file extension in the Suggested Name field, as X-Author automatically saves it in DOCX format.

ul.li: Select Include Watermark, to add one to a non-final version. This option is available with the With Redlines and Without Redlines options.

Include Watermark is automatically deselected (greyed out) if you are saving the document as Final - to be signed.
If the document already contains a watermark, the watermark will be removed instead when this option is chosen.

li.p: Select Reconcile Document to synchronize the Salesforce Agreement object fields with those that were updated in the document.
Select Mark as private to enable the Private indicator for this agreement (only for use in custom implementationsâ€“see the Apttus Contract Management Administrator Guide for more information).
Click Submit to confirm check-in of the document.

stepresult.p: The document is checked in to Salesforce and the new document version is downloaded from the agreement record.

li.p: Close the document you just checked in (no need to save) and load the newly downloaded document to continue working with the agreement, if necessary.

note.p: If there are any invalid fields in your agreement, a message is displayed and the check-in is not completed. Return to Document > Fields to validate fields and make corrected as needed.
